name: Now for the Ninth Season of "Cheers" Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 25 Questions

questions.text: Did Sam ever tell the people at Cheers that he slept with Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	He wouldn't tell them for the longest time because he didn't think Rebecca would want him to. Then, when he finally told everyone the truth they didn't believe him.

questions.text: What Boston Celtics player guest starred in "Cheers Fouls Out"?
questions.explanation:
Kevin McHale.

	Kevin McHale was number 32 on the Boston Celtics. He played on the team from 1980 until he retired in 1993.

questions.text: What talk show was Jeanne Marie on that caused Rebecca to become upset?
questions.explanation:
The Arsenio Hall Show.

	Rebecca was jealous that Robin's other girlfriend was getting all the press while she was ignored.

questions.text: Who does Cliff become jealous of in "Mom Always Liked You Best"?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Woody and Cliff's mom have become close, she even taught Woody bird trivia.

questions.text: What is Norm's favorite place to eat in "Grease"?
questions.explanation:
Hungry Heifer.

	Sid wants to burn his restaurant down and keeps telling Norm: "Light the match, Norm."

questions.text: Who goes with Rebecca to see Robin in prison?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla is a big hit with the other prisoners.

questions.text: Who hosted the "Anniversary Show" of "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
John McLaughlin.

	John McLaughlin was the host of "The McLaughlin Group."

questions.text: Who plays John Allen Hill?
questions.explanation:
Keene Curtis.

	Keene Curtis also played Lou Bond on an episode of "Full House".

questions.text: Which of the following was an ingredient in "Veggie Boy"?
questions.explanation:
kale.

	"Kale was not a good idea." - Frasier

questions.text: Who became addicted to the home shopping network?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	"I don't need help, I just need more credit." - Woody. This episode was dedicated to the memory of Al Rosen, who played Al or "The Man Who Said Sinatra."

questions.text: Who played Henri?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Cistaro.

	Anthony Cistaro graduated magna cum laude from college.

questions.text: What does Carla's son Gino get renamed due to a Luzapone tradition?
questions.explanation:
Benito Mussolini.

	Woody: "His name is now Benito Mussolini. They call him Gino for short."

questions.text: Does Sam ever date a relative of John Allen Hill's?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Sam dated Hill's daughter.

questions.text: What song does Rebecca sing to Sam before collapsing from being drunk in "Days of Wine and Neuroses"?
questions.explanation:
We've Got Tonight.

	She was drinking a lot because she realized she didn't want to marry Robin now that he wasn't rich anymore.

questions.text: Robin and Rebecca have their own vows. Robin quotes a Shakespearean sonnet. What does Rebecca say?
questions.correct: I only loved you for your money.
options: She sang 'You Lost that Lovin' Feelin'
questions.explanation:
I only loved you for your money.

	For those of you who want to know the sonnet Robin recited here it is. I got it from http://www.greatest-love-poems.com/shakespeare/shakespeare_shall_I_compare_thee.htm. "Thou art more lovely and more temperate:Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, And summer's lease hath all too short a date: Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines, And often is his gold complexion dimmed,And every fair from fair sometime declines, By chance, or nature's changing course untrimmed;But thy eternal summer shall not fade,Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow'st, Nor shall death brag thou wand'rest in his shade, When in eternal lines to time thou grow'st; So long as men can breathe, or eyes can see, So long lives this, and this gives life to thee."

questions.text: What does Sam do when he thinks Rebecca is coming back to Cheers because she's in love with him?
questions.explanation:
Pretends he's gay.

	He has to kiss another man to prove to Rebecca he's not scared.

questions.text: On what holiday does Sam always go to Vermont to see Lauren?
questions.explanation:
Valentine's Day.

	Lauren was played by Barbara Feldon, who played 99 on "Get Smart".

questions.text: Who ends up buying the back rooms from Hill?
questions.explanation:
both.

	Sam and Rebecca go in as partners because together they have enough money to buy the bathroom and pool room from Hill.

questions.text: Who is the voice of Vera?
questions.explanation:
Bernadette Birkett.

	Birkett is George Wendt (Norm)'s wife in real life.

questions.text: In "Cheers Has Chili," how does Rebecca make Sam cry?
questions.correct: She breaks the windows in his car
options: Tells him about her cat dying
questions.explanation:
She breaks the windows in his car.

	Sam was jealous of the success of Rebecca's tea room so he made the chili pot blow up.

questions.text: Does Carla win the Boston Bar Maid Contest?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Carla was the best waitress, but not the best looking so the judges dind't vote for her to win the contest.

questions.text: Who does Sam pitch for in "Pitch It Again, Sam"?
questions.explanation:
Dutch Kincaid.

	Dutch Kincaid was played by Michael Fairman.

questions.text: What is the name of Lilith's "favorite dead rat"?
questions.explanation:
Whitey.

	Her rat died and she was carrying him around in her purse.

questions.text: What happens to Sam when he babysits Frederick Crane?
questions.correct: He's locked out of the house
options: Frederick calls the cops on him
questions.explanation:
He's locked out of the house.

	Sam goes out the window to the bathroom when Frederick locks himself in. However, the window closes and Sam is locked out of the house so he watches Frederick from a tree.

questions.text: When Sam tells Frasier he was talking to Elvis, what does Frasier reply?
questions.explanation:
The man is dead.

	Elvis was played by Pete Wilcox. He's also played Elvis in "Full House" and "ER".
